filmography.title: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
filmography.role_description: A shy, beloved schoolmaster at a British boarding school whose life is transformed by love and tragedy as he dedicates decades to teaching 'his boys'.
filmography.plot: An aged teacher recalls his long career and personal life over the decades at a British boarding school.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Heroes (#41)

filmography.title: The 39 Steps
filmography.role_description: A Canadian civilian in London who gets wrongfully accused of murder and must go on the run to clear his name while uncovering a spy ring.
filmography.plot: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage agent, but when the agent is killed and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring.

filmography.title: The Citadel
filmography.role_description: An idealistic young doctor who starts out treating poor Welsh miners but eventually loses his way treating wealthy hypochondriacs in London.
filmography.plot: An idealistic doctor treats the poor in a Welsh mining village, but his success eventually leads him to London's high society where he loses sight of his original goals.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; National Board of Review: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
filmography.role_description: A man wrongfully imprisoned for years who escapes to find a hidden treasure and uses it to exact elaborate revenge on those who betrayed him.
filmography.plot: After being unjustly imprisoned for 20 years, Edmond Dantes escapes, finds a buried treasure, and returns to take revenge on the men who betrayed him.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top 10 Films

filmography.title: The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
filmography.role_description: A wise and powerful local ruler in China who initially opposes but eventually respects the work of missionary Gladys Aylward.
filmography.plot: The true story of Gladys Aylward, a British maid who becomes a missionary in China during the turbulent years leading up to World War II.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor (Drama); National Board of Review: Special Citation

filmography.title: The Winslow Boy
filmography.role_description: A brilliant, cold, and highly respected barrister who risks his career to defend a young naval cadet wrongly accused of theft.
filmography.plot: A father fights to clear his son's name after the boy is expelled from a naval college for stealing a postal order.

filmography.title: The Private Life of Henry VIII
filmography.role_description: The handsome and tragic lover of Katherine Howard, King Henry VIII's fifth wife.
filmography.plot: King Henry VIII moves through several wives in his quest for an heir, with tragedy and comedy ensuing in his court.

filmography.title: The Ghost Goes West
filmography.role_description: Donat plays a dual role: a cowardly 18th-century Scottish ghost doomed to haunt a castle, and his broke modern-day descendant who sells the castle to an American.
filmography.plot: An American millionaire buys a Scottish castle and dismantles it to ship it to Florida, unaware that it comes with a resident ghost.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Nominated – Mussolini Cup

filmography.title: Knight Without Armour
filmography.role_description: A British spy operating in Russia during the revolution who is tasked with protecting a beautiful Countess.
filmography.plot: A British spy helps a Russian Countess escape from Bolshevik revolutionaries during the Russian Civil War.

filmography.title: Lease of Life
filmography.role_description: A quiet country vicar who, upon learning he has a terminal illness, finds a new lease on life and courage to speak his mind.
filmography.plot: A vicar with a year to live decides to preach what he truly believes, shaking up his small parish.

filmography.title: The Magic Box
filmography.role_description: A biographical role playing the British inventor and cinema pioneer who obsessed over creating moving pictures at the cost of his family life.
filmography.plot: A biopic of William Friese-Greene, the British inventor who created an early version of the motion picture camera.

filmography.title: Perfect Strangers (Vacation from Marriage)
filmography.role_description: A sickly, timid clerk who joins the Navy during WWII and is transformed into a confident, robust man, dreading the return to his old life.
filmography.plot: A dull married couple are separated by enlistment in WWII; both change drastically and dread their reunion, only to find they are now perfect strangers.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Story (Clemence Dane)

filmography.title: The Adventures of Tartu
filmography.role_description: A British soldier fluent in languages who goes undercover as a flamboyant Romanian Iron Guard member to sabotage a Nazi gas factory.
filmography.plot: A British officer goes undercover in Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia to sabotage a poison gas factory.

filmography.title: The Young Mr. Pitt
filmography.role_description: A historical biopic role playing William Pitt the Younger, who became Britain's youngest Prime Minister and led the country against Napoleon.
filmography.plot: A biography of William Pitt the Younger, focusing on his political battles and leadership during the Napoleonic Wars.

filmography.title: The Cure for Love
filmography.role_description: A war veteran returning home to Lancashire who finds himself pursued by an aggressive fiancée while falling for a sweet lodger.
filmography.plot: A soldier returns home on leave to find he is engaged to a woman he doesn't love, while falling for the woman lodging with his mother.

filmography.title: Captain Boycott
filmography.role_description: A brief but commanding cameo as the Irish nationalist leader whose speech inspires the farmers to use ostracization tactics.
filmography.plot: Irish farmers in 1880 use a new tactic of social ostracization against a tyrannical English land agent, Captain Boycott.

filmography.title: Cash
filmography.role_description: A young employee who helps a struggling businessman stay afloat while romancing his daughter.
filmography.plot: A businessman on the brink of bankruptcy struggles to keep his company afloat and hide his financial state.

filmography.title: That Night in London
filmography.role_description: A young bank clerk who steals money and plans a night of high living before intending to take his own life.
filmography.plot: A young bank clerk steals 500 pounds and plans a spree in London, but a chance encounter changes his plans.

filmography.title: Men of Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: Donat's film debut as an Oxford student in this drama about university life.
filmography.plot: A drama about the lives and loves of students at Oxford University.

filmography.title: The New Lot
filmography.role_description: A cameo role in a propaganda/training film intended for new recruits during WWII.
filmography.plot: Five men from different backgrounds are conscripted into the Army and learn to work together as a team.
